intro: Schizoglossum atropurpureum subsp. virens, commonly known as the purpleleaf false nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes species known for their stinging hairs. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive purple underside, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it identifiable by its unique leaf coloration and growth habits.
